meanings.definition: A prostitute or paramour, especially one associating with noblemen or men of wealth.
meanings.sent1: The courtesans in the olden days were often seen in the company of rich gentlemen.
meanings.sent2: She aspired to become a courtesan and live a life of luxury.
meanings.sent3: The courtesans of the past knew how to charm their wealthy suitors.
meanings.sent4: In some societies, courtesans were admired for their beauty and wit.
meanings.sent5: The image of courtesans in historical novels is often romanticized.

meanings.definition: A woman who is a mistress or companion to a wealthy or upper-class man.
meanings.sent1: The courtesans of the aristocracy were always elegantly dressed.
meanings.sent2: She was rumored to be the courtesan of a wealthy businessman.
meanings.sent3: The courtesans at the gala were the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: The courtesan's lavish lifestyle was the envy of many.
meanings.sent5: In period dramas, courtesans are portrayed as glamorous and alluring.
